title: Person of Interest - Acting Analysis and Tips for Animators (part 1)
author: Jean-Denis Haas
comment: Yes!! One of my all-time favorite TV series

Now that you have mentioned Contrast. I haven't watched Westworld much but Jimmy Simpson usually plays off on contrast in subtle interesting ways whether it's Breakout Kings or It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. It's almost like he uses it like controlled bursts of energy followed by silence or vice versa.

Great video analysis. This show is great at working contrasting characters work off of each other. Hell, it is one of the key parts of the series. One of the many reasons it is my favorite series. 

I remember back in season 1, listening to a podcast that was analyzing Finch limps and lack of them in the flashbacks and trying to unveil the origins of it.
description:
This clip is all about character contrast in terms of movement and gestures. So if you have two (or more) characters, what could you do to set them apart? Watch the acting analysis clip for that and more,  using the TV show "Person of Interest" as an example.

You can watch the sequence here:
